bibl.title: Letter from Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon to George A. Kellogg, December 23, 1941

div1.p: Agramonte's daughter thanks Kellogg for the print of Cornwell's painting.

div1.head: Letter from Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon to George A. Kellogg, December 23, 1941
div1.opener:
15 Street No. 311
Vedado, Havana, Cuba
December 23, 1941
Mr. George B. Kellogg
Dear Mr. Kellogg:
div1.p:
About a week ago and thrugh the kind
attention of Mr. Montalvo Pirez, I had the pleasure of
receiving the handsome framed engraver's print and
autographed copy you so kindly sent me. Thank you very
much indeed.

I have placed the picture in the
entrance hall of our apartment, under a large portrait
of my father in uniform, of about the same period as
Cornwell's painting. Several people who have been here
have discussed the picture with much interest. In
general their remarks--aside from small discrepancies--
have been favorable.

I am very glad to have it and grateful
to you for sending me a copy as attractively framed and
autographed.

Allow me to extend to you the most
cordial best wishes of the reason. May this next year
see the end of the terrible war which seems to have spread
to the whole world and is coming so near home in this
hemisphere.

Again thanking you for all your kindness
to me, I remain,
